instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00045: What is 820-00045? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .
definitions.PPBUS_S0_LCDBKLT_PWR_SW: What is PPBUS_S0_LCDBKLT_PWR_SW? PPBUS_S0_LCDBKLT_PWR_SW is a line after the inductor in the DC to DC boost circuit for backlight that connects to the LED driverâ€™s switch(SW) pin where it is switched to ground rapidly in order to create the boosted voltage for the backlight circuit. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: No imaged on display
threads.message:
I have this board that doesn't have image to the screen (no backlight or image). The owner states it had a Shorted out keyboard/trackpad and the has screen issues intermittently. I've tried a new display with the same outcome.

Here are some measurements taken so far. This will be my first no image troubleshooting on this type of board as most times it's always the display

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_S0_LCDBKLT_PWR_SW</SIGNAL> 1.2V
<SIGNAL>EDP_PANEL_PWR</SIGNAL> - 0v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> - 3.3v

Any suggestions?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: No imaged on display
threads.message: Do you have USB activity, or external video?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: No imaged on display
threads.message: Yes to USB activity, no to external video. Tried both a desktop monitor and TV with same result.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: No imaged on display
threads.message:
Are you sure about USB activity?
Activity and 5V output from USB is not the same.
Can you see flashing boot pendrive?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: No imaged on display
threads.message: It flashes on then off once, then finally back on and stays solid

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: No imaged on display
threads.message:
Then board is stuck, no USB activity.
No reason to search for video, in such case.

Very likely bad CPU, classic problem of these boards.
You can try to reflow the entire board.
May have luck and recover data.
